description: Baseline tests for Cannabis regulatory compliance and legal guidance

categories.licensing: State licensing and regulatory framework requirements
categories.testing: Product testing and quality assurance standards
categories.security: Security, surveillance and facility protection requirements
categories.labeling: Product labeling, packaging and consumer information

questions.question: What are the key requirements for cannabis regulatory compliance in Colorado?
questions.expected_answer: Key requirements include state licensing through the Marijuana Enforcement Division, seed-to-sale tracking via METRC, testing requirements, security measures, and local municipality approval

questions.question: What are the key requirements for cannabis regulatory compliance in California?
questions.expected_answer: Key requirements include state licensing through the Department of Cannabis Control, track-and-trace via CCTT system, testing requirements, security measures, and local municipality approval

questions.question: What are the key requirements for cannabis regulatory compliance in Washington?
questions.expected_answer: Key requirements include state licensing through the Liquor and Cannabis Board, seed-to-sale tracking via WSLCB traceability system, testing requirements, security measures, and local municipality approval

questions.question: What testing requirements must cannabis products meet before retail sale in California?
questions.expected_answer: Products must be tested for potency, pesticides, heavy metals, residual solvents, microbials, mycotoxins, and foreign material by state-licensed laboratories. California requires comprehensive COA documentation.

questions.question: What testing requirements must cannabis products meet before retail sale in Colorado?
questions.expected_answer: Products must be tested for potency, pesticides, heavy metals, residual solvents, microbials, and mycotoxins by state-licensed laboratories. Colorado requires batch testing and proper chain of custody.

questions.question: What security requirements are mandatory for cannabis facilities in Washington?
questions.expected_answer: Requirements include 24/7 video surveillance with 45-day retention, alarm systems, limited access areas, visitor logs, secure storage for products and cash, and reporting to WSLCB

questions.question: What security requirements are mandatory for cannabis facilities in California?
questions.expected_answer: Requirements include 24/7 video surveillance with 90-day retention, alarm systems, limited access areas, visitor logs, secure storage, background checks, and compliance with local security ordinances

questions.question: How should cannabis products be properly labeled for retail sale in Oregon?
questions.expected_answer: Labels must include potency information, serving sizes, warning statements, batch numbers, test results, OLCC license numbers, and cannot make medical claims or target minors

questions.question: How should cannabis products be properly labeled for retail sale in Colorado?
questions.expected_answer: Labels must include potency information, serving sizes, universal symbol, warning statements, batch numbers, test results, MED license numbers, and cannot make medical claims

questions.question: How do excise tax rates differ between Colorado, California, and Washington for cannabis products?
questions.expected_answer: Colorado has 15% excise tax, California has 15% excise tax plus cultivation taxes, Washington has 37% excise tax. Each state also allows additional local taxes.
